desc: Trump is sworn in as 45th President of the United States before a crowd of around 160,000 people in Washington, DC, with a speech in which he declared that he alone could fix the "American carnage" he saw before him.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Millions of protesters against his administration join the Women's March in cities and towns around the world, including around 500,000 in Washington, DC.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A furious White House press secretary, Sean Spicer, makes an unscheduled first appearance in the White House briefing room and berates journalists for what he claims are their falsehoods.  "This was the largest audience to ever witness an inauguration, period," he says. Around 1.8 million people attended Barack Obama's first inauguration.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: During a speech at CIA headquarters in front of  a wall dedicated to those who died in service to the agency, Trump repeats at length false claims about the size of his inauguration crowds.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump withdraws the US from the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: During a private meeting with congressional leaders, Trump repeats his unsubstantiated claim that 3 to 5 million illegal votes cost him a popular vote triumph over Hillary Clinton.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump signs executive orders reversing Obama's halt to the Keystone XL and Dakota Access oil pipelines.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump signs executive orders directing the federal government to fund construction of a southern border wall and to suspend funding to cities that offer sanctuary to undocumented immigrants.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: President Enrique Pena Nieto of Mexico cancels a trip to the US to meet with Trump after Trump repeats his demand that Mexico pay for a border wall separating the two countries.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump signs executive order banning all entry of foreign nationals from seven Muslim-majority countries, indefinitely suspending resettlement of Syrian refugees, and suspending all refugee resettlement for 120 days.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: â€‹Trump meets with UK Prime Minister Theresa May, who becomes the first foreign leader to meet with the new US President.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Federal District Court judge issues a stay, blocking implementation of Trump's "Muslim ban" executive order.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The Yakla commando raid against Al-Qaeda in Yemen is launched, leading to the death of one American and a number of civilian casualties. In the coming weeks, the Trump administration goes back and forth between hailing the raid as a great success and blaming its failures on former president Obama, who did not authorise it.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump fires Acting Attorney-General Sally Yates, an Obama holdover, after she ordered Department of Justice employees not to defend the president's "Muslim ban" order due to doubts over its legality.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump nominates Neil Gorsuch to fill the US Supreme Court seat vacated by the death of Antonin Scalia in 2016.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump discusses the controversial refugee resettlement deal during a tense and truncated phone call with Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A district court judge in the Western District of Washington temporarily blocks Trump's "Muslim ban" order.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The 9th Circuit Court of Appeals denies a request from the Trump Administration to immediately reinstate the temporarily blocked travel ban.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Vice President Mike Pence has to cast the deciding vote in the 51-50 confirmation of Betsy DeVos as Secretary of Education. The billionaire fundraiser for Republican causes has long campaigned against public education and suggested during her confirmation hearings that schools might use guns to defend themselves from grizzly bears.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump agrees to continue America's "One China" policy after a telephone discussion with Chinese President Xi Jinping. This follows an unorthodox call between Trump and Taiwanese president Tsai Ing-wen in December 2016.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Responding to a decision by a major US retail chain to dump Ivanka Trump products, one of Trump's most senior advisors, Kellyanne Conway, sparks controversy by saying on Fox News: "Go buy Ivanka's stuff is what I would tell you. I'm going to give a free commercial here. Go buy it today, everybody.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump meets with Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe at the White House and the two travel together to Trump's Mar-a-Lago in Florida. Fee-paying club members watch on, some recording the talks between the two leaders on phones and posting to social media.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: National Security Adviser Michael Flynn resigns after it is revealed he lied to government officials about his contacts with the Russian ambassador to the United States.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Andrew Puzder, Trump's choice to be Secretary of Commerce, withdraws his nomination under pressure of scandals involving employment of an illegal immigrant.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Deputy FBI Director Andrew McCabe refuses a secret request from White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus to publicly dispute reports that Trump associates had been in regular contact with Russian agents.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump holds a 75-minute long press conference in which he attacks the media, denies any ties to Russia while accusing Hillary Clinton of having them, and asks an African-American reporter to arrange a meeting with the Congressional Black Caucus. The presser is widely regarded as bizarre.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Day Without Immigrants" protests are held throughout the country, with immigrants walking off the job to demonstrate their importance to the economy.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Senate confirms Scott Pruitt as head of Environmental Protection Agency. He does not believe carbon emissions cause climate change and had previously declared his opposition to the EPA's "environmental activism".
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Still angry about the reporting of his inauguration crowd size Trump says via Twitter that a handful of major US news outlets are "the enemy of the American People!
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump holds a campaign-style rally in Melbourne, Florida, in front of 9000 supporters. He attacks the media and hails his own administration as successful, and implies Sweden had been subject to a terror attack the previous night.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump withdraws federal protection of Title IX, the federal law that bars gender discrimination, from transgender students.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson meets with Australian Foreign Affairs Minister Julie Bishop.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: It is announced that six White House staffers had been removed from their posts after failing FBI background checks.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The White House bars The New York Times, CNN, Politico, Los Angeles Times and Buzzfeed News from a news briefing.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump speaks at the Conservative Political Action Conference  and attacks the media, Islamic State and illegal immigrants, while touting himself and the coal industry. He suggests a limitation on the use of anonymous sources by news reporters.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump announces plans for a  9 per cent hike in military spending, as well as huge spending cuts at the Environmental Protection Agency and State Department.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Speaking to the Today Show on NBC, former president George W. Bush, implicitly criticises Trump's handling of the media and religious freedom.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump's first speech to Congress, outlining  his policy priorities.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The Justice Department confirms that Attorney-General Jeff Sessions met twice with the Russian ambassador to the US. in 2016.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Sessions recuses himself from investigating links between Trump's campaign and the Kremlin.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump admits former national security adviser Michael Flynn and Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner met with the Russian ambassador at Trump Tower in December 2016.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Former Texas governor Rick Perry, who declared during a failed presidential bid that he would abolish the Department of Energy, is confirmed as Secretary of Energy.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Presenting no evidence Trump accuses former president Barack Obama of having tapped his phones during the campaign.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Former Director of National Intelligence James Clapper denies Trump was ever wiretapped.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Devin Nunes, the Republican chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, agrees to investigate Trump's assertion that he was wiretapped during the election campaign.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump issues a new "Muslim ban" executive order, this time covering six countries after Iraq was removed from the list of proscribed nations.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump confidant and former campaign adviser Roger Stone admits he had personal communication with Guccifer 2.0, the hacker responsible for leaking the Democratic National Committee emails.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A federal court in Hawaii temporarily blocks implementation of Trump's second "Muslim ban" executive order.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump meets with German Chancellor Angela Merkel and publicly refuses to shake her hand during a photo op. (They did shake hands earlier.)
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: UK Government Communications Headquarters (GCHQ) denies wiretapping Trump, as alleged by a former judge Andrew Napolitano on Fox News. The White House, which promoted the theory, apologises and promises not to repeat the allegation.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Secretary of State Tillerson wraps up his east Asia tour by meeting Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: During a House Intelligence Committee hearing, FBI Director James Comey testifies that the FBI has no evidence to support Trump's wiretapping allegations. He also testifies that the FBI investigation into Russian influence on the presidential election includes possible links between Trump campaign officials and the Russian government.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Nunes briefs Trump on evidence about wiretapping by the Obama administration. Nunes' private and undisclosed briefing draws immediate fire from Democrats and some Republicans.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: In a devastating blow to one of Trump's signature campaign promises, the Republican Speaker of the House Paul Ryan withdraws the Obamacare repeal bill, to prevent it from meeting a humiliating failure in Congress, where it was opposed by Democrats as well as moderate and hard-right Republican factions.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump announces that his son in law, Jared Kushner, a New Yorker who inherited his father's real estate empire, will lead an overhaul of the entire US government. Kushner is also responsible for seeking a Middle East peace agreement, steering US relations with China and Mexico and solving America's opioid epidemic.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The White House denies it tried to prevent former Acting Attorney-General Sally Yates from testifying to Congress about possible ties between the Russian government and Trump campaign officials.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: White House announces Ivanka Trump, the president's oldest daughter, will become an unpaid assistant in the West Wing.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Former national security adviser Michael Flynn offers to testify to Congress about Russian attempts to influence the 2016 US election in return for immunity from prosecution. The offer is refused by Congress.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump tweets that investigations into his ties to the Russian government constitute a "witch hunt".
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A federal judge rules that a lawsuit against Trump by three protesters who were physically assaulted during a Trump campaign rally in 2016 can proceed.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump's powerful advisor Steve Bannon is removed from his position on the National Security Council. The move is widely interpreted as a sign that more moderate factions are exerting greater influence in a White House marked by a bitter ideological divide.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Following a chemical attack on civilians by Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, Trump calls the attack "reprehensible" and criticises former president Obama for not doing more to stop such atrocities. However, in previous years Trump repeatedly and publicly insisted that Obama stay out of the Syrian civil war.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump alleges former national security adviser Susan Rice committed a crime by seeking the names of his team who may have been incidentally mentioned on intercepted communications of foreigners. Trump provides no evidence for his accusation and Rice denies it. Later in the month, officials from both parties will agree that Rice committed no wrongdoing.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump orders 59 Tomahawk cruise missiles fired at the Shayrat Air Base in Homs, Syria, in retaliation for the chemical weapons attack on 4 April. The attack earns widespread praise from the media and members of both parties.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Chinese President Xi Jinping meets Trump at his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida. Trump informs him of the missile strike over dessert, which he boasts was "the most beautiful piece of chocolate cake that you've ever seen". Also on this day the Chinese government extended trademarks to Ivanka Trump's businesses so she could access Chinese markets with her shoe and handbag lines.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Nunes recuses himself from the House Intelligence Committee investigation into Trump ties to Russia, following widespread condemnation of his collusion with the Trump White House.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The Senate confirms the nomination of Justice Neil Gorsuch to the Supreme Court, an appointment many consider to be Trump's most significant achievement to date.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: White House announces that a US Navy battle group led by the USS Carl Vinson is being diverted from a planned visit to Australia, instead moving towards the Korean peninsula over security concerns related to North Korea's atomic weapons program. However, days later the claim comes under fire when photos show the group near Indonesia and headed towards the Indian Ocean.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: White House spokesman Sean Spicer issues an apology for inaccurate and  offensive remarks he made comparing Syrian President Assad to Adolf Hitler.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump declares that NATO is no longer obsolete, as he maintained through the election and in the early weeks of his presidency.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: In major reversals of campaign pledges, Trump announces he will not label China a currency manipulator, that he no longer wants to eliminate the Import-Export Bank and the he is willing to consider re-appointing Janet Yellen as chair of the Federal Reserve.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A Massive Ordnance Air Blast (MOAB) bomb is dropped by the US on a terrorist-used cave complex in Afghanistan.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The White House announces it will not release a visitors log, as was routine under the Obama administration.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Tax Day rallies are held around the country, with many demonstrators demanding Trump release his tax returns. Trump rejects the demand and ridicules the protesters.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Vice President Mike Pence arrives in South Korea and denounces a failed North Korean missile test earlier that day as a "provocation".
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Pence visits the Korean Demilitarised Zone and declares that the "era of strategic patience" is over regarding the North Korean atomic weapons program.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A Washington Post/ABC News poll reveals Trump to be the least popular president at the 100-day mark since 1945, with 42 per cent approval. Trump dismisses the poll via Twitter as "fake". Other polling shows he remains overwhelmingly popular among those who voted for him.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump calls Turkish strongman Recep Tayyip Erdogan to congratulate him for his victory in a referendum that left him with dictatorial powers. His call was made just hours after the US State Department noted reports of "irregularities on voting day and an uneven playing field during the difficult campaign period.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Tom Ricketts, Trump's pick for Deputy Commerce Secretary withdraws from consideration, citing conflicts of interest with his vast financial holdings.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump signs an order directing the Commerce Department to investigate whether steel imports are a threat to US national security.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: At the end of his Asia-Pacific tour, Pence is met at Sydney Airport by Australian Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Pence meets with Australian PM Malcolm Turnbull and says the US will honour a refugee deal with Australia that Trump previously called "dumb" and led to a tense phone call with Turnbull back on 1 February.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: A San Francisco judge blocks Trump's executive order withholding funds from so-called "sanctuary" cities.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: The White House announces that Trump and Turnbull will hold their first face-to-face meeting on May 2, on board the USS Intrepid, a decommissioned World War II aircraft carrier, as it hosts commemorations for the 75th anniversary of the Battle of the Coral Sea.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump fires shots in what some fear could become a trade war with Canada, slapping tariffs on lumber imports.  He tweeted: "Canada has made business for our dairy farmers in Wisconsin and other border states very difficult. We will not stand for this. Watch!
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump outlines his tax package - a single-page statement with bullet points - proposing reductions in income tax rates for individuals and businesses that Democrats said would significantly benefit the wealthy.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley

desc: Trump due to mark his 100th day in office.
source: The Sydney Morning Hearald - Nick O'Malley
